snippet.title: Edward Snowden to speak at South by Southwest
snippet.description: The NSA leaker, who is living in exile, will appear by teleconference on Monday during the interactive portion of the annual Texas festival. He joins fellow wanted man Julian Assange, who is also speaking remotely at SXSW Interactive.

snippet.title: NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden to hold Q&A Thursday
snippet.description: Former NSA contractor is expected to offer his opinion on NSA reforms President Obama announced last week.

snippet.title: ACLU: 'Obama, grant Edward Snowden immunity now'
snippet.description: Days before the president is scheduled to announce possible reform proposals to the NSA's surveillance programs, the civil liberties group creates a petition calling for Snowden's amnesty.

snippet.title: Edward Snowden action figure makes for toy whistle-blower
snippet.description: The famed whistle-blower gets turned into an unlikely action figure to help you fulfill your playtime reenactments of the NSA spying scandal.

snippet.title: Obama, NSA dissed by report as Edward Snowden reappears
snippet.description: NSA surveillance and Obama administration policies are putting a damper on freedom of the press, says a report. Meanwhile, Prism leaker Edward Snowden accepts an award in Moscow.

snippet.title: Edward Snowden gets crowdsourced support
snippet.description: Campaigns are underway online to raise support -- and cash -- for the recently revealed source who leaked details of the NSA's PRISM program.

snippet.title: Matt Damon: Edward Snowden did a great thing
snippet.description: In a brief interview slipped onto YouTube, the actor who must know a thing or two about the covert world offers that Edward Snowden seems "conscientious" and that we should all decide whether to give up our civil liberties.

snippet.title: Edward Snowden and the Rubik's Cube meet-up
snippet.description: The New York Times sits down with Guardian reporter Glenn Greenwald and documentarian Laura Poitras to get behind-the-scenes information on how they communicated with NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden.

snippet.title: Edward Snowden offered $100K tweeting job
snippet.description: MeetAtTheAirport.com offers the whistleblower $100,000 to tweet on its behalf. A stipulation of the offer is that he mustn't leak classified information.

snippet.title: Edward Snowden cast as hero in smartphone game
snippet.description: The NSA leaker wanted by U.S. authorities stars in the mobile game Snowden Run 3D. In the endless runner, players must collect "sensitive information" while avoiding the long arm of the law.
